cyclone.name: GRACE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi (200 km) SE of Port-au-Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving west to west-northwest through the central Caribbean Sea toward Jamaica, the Cayman Islands and the Yucatán Peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of Hispaniola (near Haiti/Dominican Republic border)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: 0 (system is already well west of the U.S. Virgin Islands)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the entire coasts of the Dominican Republic, Haiti and Jamaica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Hispaniola today; Jamaica, southern Cuba and Cayman Islands Tuesday–Wednesday; Yucatán Peninsula late week
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (no USVI point in the probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast totals 2–4 inches for USVI were below 4 inches)
weather_observation.wind: No additional strong winds expected; lingering gusts below tropical-storm force possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers with residual rainfall totals 1–3 inches possible, but heavy rain threat has shifted west of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rip currents and rough seas subside gradually as Grace moves away
